elements.title: 2010 Japanese Grand Prix (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fernando Alonso (pictured in car) finished third at the 2010 Japanese Grand Prix while his Ferrari teammate Felipe Massa crashed out at the first corner?

elements.title: Baalshillem II (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that coins issued by Baalshillem II, the Phoenician king of Sidon, were the first Sidonian coins to bear minting dates corresponding to the king's year of reign?

elements.title: Memorandum on Genuine Autonomy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Dalai Lama's 2008 Memorandum on Genuine Autonomy was a proposal aiming for autonomy rather than full independence for Tibet?

elements.title: Research Policy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Research Policy is regarded as the leading journal in the field of innovation studies?

elements.title: Comet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the card game Comet, originally called Manille, was renamed in 1682 after the appearance of Halley's Comet?

elements.title: Victor Jaques (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British brigadier Victor Jaques was almost killed by friendly fire from an American aircraft in Bangkok in 1945?

elements.title: used throughout his career (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chuck Mosley described the distinctive singing style used throughout his career as "screaming to the beat, like ranting"?

elements.title: Alia Issa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alia Issa, the first woman competitor to enter during the 2020 Paralympics opening ceremony, is the first female refugee to compete at any Paralympic Games?
